channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Fauci's Senate testimony contrasts with Trump's messaging
4 key takeaways from Dr. Fauci's testimony on Trump's coronavirus response
Prominent model's projected US death toll rises again
GOP sen. tells Fauci he isn't the 'end all.' See his response
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci warned against claims that children are immune to coronavirus, citing new cases where some children have developed a mysterious inflammatory syndrome that could be linked to the virus.

item.title: Trump lawyer argues in Supreme Court case about financial records: President gets 'temporary' immunity
item.description: The Supreme Court is considering Tuesday whether the House of Representatives and a New York prosecutor can subpoena President Donald Trump's accounting firm and banks for his financial documents, two momentous disputes concerning separation of powers and Trump's broad claims of immunity.

item.title: UK railway ticket office worker dies from Covid-19 after being spat on
item.description: A British railway ticket office worker has died from Covid-19 after being spat on while she was working at Victoria station in central London.

item.title: Now is the priciest time to buy stocks in 20 years
item.description: The US stock market stands 4% higher today compared to a year ago, despite the death and destruction unleashed by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: New York Times journalist: Fauci hearing was terrifying
item.description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour speaks with New York Times health and science reporter Donald G. McNeil Jr. about Dr. Anthony Fauci's Senate appearance.

item.title: McConnell should know better than to tell the first black US president to 'keep his mouth shut'
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell prides himself on being a student of history and politics. Which is why what he said Monday about former President Barack Obama is so egregious.

item.title: Kobe and Gianna Bryant knew risks of flying, helicopter company alleges
item.description: The helicopter company involved in the January crash that killed NBA legend Kobe Bryant denied wrongdoing and claimed that he and his daughter Gianna knew of the risks involved in flying, according to court papers.

item.title: Man refusing to wear mask breaks arm of store employee
item.description: Two men were arrested for felony battery after starting a fight with employees at a Los Angeles Target store over wearing masks inside the store.

item.title: How coronavirus traveled the world, leaving death behind
Putin's coronavirus crisis deepens with fatal hospital fire and spokesman's diagnosis
Why a positive Covid-19 antibody test doesn't mean much of anything yet
item.description: You're about to get a blood test to see if you have been exposed to Covid-19, the deadly disease caused by the novel coronavirus.

item.title: Wuhan to test all residents for coronavirus in 10 days after new cases emerge
item.description: Millions of people in Wuhan will be tested for the novel coronavirus within the coming days, after a new cluster of cases emerged despite a strict 76-day lockdown that was intended to eliminate the virus from the central Chinese city.

item.title: Virus outbreak linked to Seoul clubs popular with LGBT community stokes homophobia
California lawmaker on Tesla reopen: 'F*** Elon Musk'
item.description: California State Assemblywoman Lorena Gonzalez (D) voiced her frustration with Tesla CEO Elon Musk's announcement that the company would be "restarting production today against Alameda County rules."

item.title: I negotiated canceled flights, an unknown carrier and a 'sleep box' to get to my son
item.description: It had seemed sensible at the time -- having my British husband take our four-year-old son to the UK as the coronavirus pandemic started to take hold in Europe. He wanted to be close to his family and, as a former NHS and military paramedic, he wanted to volunteer to help if needed.

item.title: Australian lawmaker tested for Covid-19 after coughing fit in parliament
item.description: An Australian lawmaker has been tested for Covid-19 after a coughing fit in parliament on Tuesday made it difficult for him to finish his speech.

item.title: GOP Sen. Romney rebukes Trump official for what he said at briefing
item.description: Sen. Mitt Romney (R-UT) admonished HHS assistant secretary Admiral Dr. Brett Giroir for saying the US has done more testing than South Korea because of how early in the pandemic South Korea's tests were performed.

item.title: Newborn babies and mothers killed in attack on Kabul hospital
item.description: At least 80 patients were evacuated from a hospital in Kabul besieged by a "number of attackers" early on Tuesday, according to a spokesman for Afghanistan's Interior Ministry.

item.title: Trump's acting intel chief declassifies names of Obama officials who 'unmasked' Flynn
item.description: Acting Director of National Intelligence Richard Grenell has declassified and may release a list of names of former Obama administration officials who allegedly requested the "unmasking" of Michael Flynn's identity, according to the Wall Street Journal.

item.title: How llamas could hold the key to combatting Covid-19
item.description: Scientists in Ghent, Belgium have found antibodies produced in llamas blood could be critical in killing off the Covid-19 virus and saving lives. CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

item.title: Man who recorded the Ahmaud Arbery shooting has been receiving threats, attorney says
item.description: The man who recorded the fatal shooting of Ahmaud Arbery in Georgia is receiving threats after authorities announced that he's also being investigated following the killing, his attorney said.

item.title: Saudi crown prince's economic master plan could be derailed by oil price crash
item.description: Saudi Arabia is taking drastic steps to shore up its finances after the oil price crash and the coronavirus pandemic upended the economy and threatened Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's grand plan to reduce its dependence on crude exports.

item.title: Sheriff alleges inmates are infecting themselves with virus
item.description: Inmates at a California correctional facility drank from the same cup with the purpose of infecting one another, resulting in 21 cases of coronavirus, according to the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department.

item.title: India's carbon emissions drop for the first time in four decades
item.description: India has seen its first year on year reduction in carbon emissions for the first time in four decades, new analysis released Tuesday shows.

item.title: 'Deeply embarrassed' NYT food writer apologizes to Chrissy Teigen and Marie Kondo
item.description: Alison Roman is "deeply embarrassed" about comments she made regarding Chrissy Teigen and Marie Kondo.

item.title: 'Unsinkable battleship' that survived both World Wars found
item.description: The wreckage of the USS Nevada battleship, once considered "unsinkable," has been located by researchers nearly 72 years after it was sunk intentionally by the US Navy during target practice.

item.title: Mike Tyson prepares for potential return to boxing with training video that says 'I'm Back'
item.description: Iron Mike is back.

item.title: Stonehenge summer solstice celebrations canceled due to pandemic
item.description: Summer solstice celebrations at Stonehenge will not take place this year due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Any drinking or smoking while pregnant may affect newborn's brain development, study says
item.description: If you're stressed or wanting to enjoy virtual happy hour with friends while pregnant, having a glass of wine every so often may seem like a relaxing plan.

item.title: Doctor's video diaries give voice to heroes battling Covid-19
item.description: Dr. Zevy Hamburger, an anesthesiologist at New York's Mount Sinai Hospital, is sharing his experience in a series of diaries, giving a voice to healthcare heroes struggling with the everyday battle. CNN's Jason Carroll reports.

item.title: Do quarantines mean no summer vacation?
item.description: As two-week quarantine requirements around the world become de rigueur amid loosened travel restrictions, would-be summer vacationers now face a new conundrum:

item.title: What happens to the pets of Covid-19 victims
item.description: Secured head-to-toe in a white protective suit, mask, gloves and booties, animal welfare enforcement supervisor Sean Gallagher entered an apartment in northeast Miami in late March to take custody of a dog.

item.title: 5 exercises to offset too much sitting
item.description: It's another day of self-isolating, which means it's potentially another day of sitting indoors restlessly taking yet another Zoom meeting.

item.title: Hear Matthew McConaughey's message to people not wearing masks
item.description: Actor Matthew McConaughey speaks to CNN's Brianna Keilar about people not wearing masks in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Kurt Cobain's 'MTV Unplugged' guitar could sell for $1 million
item.description: The guitar that Kurt Cobain played during his 1993 "MTV Unplugged" performance is expected to sell at auction next month for at least $1 million.

item.title: Four-time world champion Vettel will leave Ferrari after series of incidents
item.description: Four-time world champion Sebastian Vettel is set to leave Ferrari at the end of the current season, the Italian team announced in a statement Tuesday.

item.title: The story behind Dennis Rodman's wedding dress
item.description: For over a decade, basketball player Dennis Rodman was one of the most recognizable people on the planet, a headline-making machine known as much for his flamboyant style as his bad-boy antics on the court. (Oh, and he also won five NBA championships.) Now, thanks to "The Last Dance," ESPN's hit series about the Chicago Bulls' dynasty of the 1990s, he's back in the spotlight.

item.title: This airplane seat design helps you socially distance on board
item.description: No one quite knows what aviation will look like in the wake of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: An expert's guide to curating your bookshelf
item.description: With remote work becoming the new normal for millions of people around the world, home offices have never mattered more.

item.title: This town is in two countries
item.description: If you want to visit the town of Baarle, head on over to northern Belgium ... or the southern tip of the Netherlands. The town straddles an international border, with half of it belonging to the Dutch and the other half to the Belgians.

item.title: Star cyclist creates trophy room ... in his sauna
item.description: Trophy-winning sports stars often decide to have cabinets erected in their living rooms to have their spoils on display for all to see.

item.title: The top US infectious disease expert said states risk triggering avoidable 'suffering and death', while the US President has urged businesses to reopen
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci, a key member of the White House's coronavirus task force, warned senators Tuesday that states and cities face serious consequences if they open up too quickly, urging states not to reopen until they know they have the capabilities to handle an inevitable uptick in cases once they relax stay-at-home orders.

item.title: 4 key takeaways from Dr. Fauci's testimony
Prominent model's projected US death toll rises again
17 striking words that separate Fauci from Trump
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci said something radical during his Senate testimony Tuesday on the Trump administration's response to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Trump's wild tweetstorm to distract from testimony
Will Trump listen to Fauci's warnings of deadly mistake?
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci and the other experts at the top tiers of the American public health system have been clear: Reopening the nation without adhering to the clear guidelines from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) would be a colossal, deadly mistake.
